name: Novotel Brisbane Airport

reviews.title: Great hotel, wonderful service.
reviews.text: Stayed overnight awaiting an early morning flight. When we told the check in clerk that my husband had had an accident whilst in Qld she arranged for a complimentary bottle of bubbly to be sent to our room. We had room service for dinner. Food was great and service amazing. We had booked a suite which was large and extremely comfortable. Only small complaint was shower in bath. Very difficult getting in and out of with arm in sling, and would imagine it would be for elderly people as well. Double glazing on windows works well. No noise at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I shouted my son(20) and his girlfriend. They were so excited and everyone treated them very well. They even let them have a voiucher for missing breakfast! The inhouse massage and food were great and they loved the pool area. Thank you for looking after them
reviews.title: Cam and Mels Fab night
Just what you need
reviews.text: I stayed here overnight 'in transit'. It is a nice and relatively new hotel. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, with large double beds. Large bathroom (although only with shower) and good toiletries are provided. There is an excellent swimming pool and gym on the top floor. The restaurant provided an excellent dinner and also first-class breakfast buffet.

There is a large shopping mall with factory outlet shops just across the road, should you need to pass the time. Word of advice - if you don't want to pay five dollars to use the hotel's airport shuttle bus, free buses link the shopping mall to the airport. However, I think they probably only operate during 'shopping hours'. These "T" buses can be found, if you've just arrived at Brisbane airport, on level 4 of the terminal building.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel well situated close to airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked the entertainment package as it included transfers to and from the Radiohead concert we were planning on seeing. Upon arrival we were told the shuttle service for this event would not be running and instead were told we had taxi vouchers (for yellow cabs only) to and from the event. We expressed this might be fine getting there but could be problematic getting home, to which we were assured there will be 3 constant lines of taxis at the event. Unfortunately this was not the case. We had to wait 1 hour and 45 minutes in the rain after the show had ended to get our cab. To add insult to injury there was such a minimal amount of yellow taxis available that when we finally did get to the front of the queue we had let dozens of other people take the waiting taxis as they were not 'yellow cabs'!
reviews.title: dissapointing 'entertainment package'

reviews.text: I did speak to reception staff at the hotel, and while they empathised, both staff, put it down to, 'thats Brisbane Taxis for you'. I understand, that some thing are out of the hotels control but I do believe they could have served there customers better, by either running the shuttle to the event as promised and advertised, or at least offering taxi vouchers for all of the taxi services operating. It seems they are aware that the yellow cab service to the Brisbane Entertainment Centre is wanting. At the very least we could have been notified before arrival that they would not be running the shuttle.
reviews.title: Everything you want from an airport hotel plus more

reviews.text: As usual, the Novotel, Brisbane Airport met and in some cases exceeded my expectations, the location makes the hotel ideal for those booked on early flights out of the city, and the quality is second to none.
reviews.title: Airport Novotel

reviews.text: After spending a month in Papua New Guinea, on a 'Dive Live Aboard', diving AMAZING reefs & pinnacles, I needed to spend one night in Brisbane before flying out to Los Angeles the following morning and decided on Novotel, Brisbane Airport for that 1 night stay.
reviews.title: Bliss... and Comfort!

reviews.text: It was a bit pricey at $319- a night, but was worth it. Very clean, modern, comfortable beds, gorgeous bathrooms.... all in all, it full filled my needs. Highly recommend it if you need something modern & close to the airport.
reviews.title: Excellent in all features

reviews.text: Extremely friendly staff and very helpful. The rooms are beyond all expectations. Would have no problems in recomending Novatel Brisbane Airport to those at home and overseas. Dining is absolutrly superb.
reviews.title: Novotel Brisbane Airport

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night with family. At first we were give a room with one king bed but we needed and booked for two beds. When we informed staff they immediately assisted up to another room within a few minutes. The room was spotless well-appointed and very modern. The bathroom was great and was clean. The bed was very good also. The breakfast was absolutely delicious but a little on the steep side, but I will be going back. Alo a great pool to go for a swim in.
reviews.title: The best place I have stayed in a long time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: We used the Novotel for an overnight stay after a flight in from the UK (arriving in the evening).
reviews.title: Expensive and limited Airport Hotel

description: Ideally positioned as the only accommodation available within the Brisbane Airport precinct, the property is conveniently located in between the Gateway Arterial roads and adjacent to the DFO Shopping Centre. Featuring 157 modern rooms and suites, state of the art conference facilities, restaurant and bar, 24 hour reception and room service, and a large rooftop heated swimming pool. All rooms are stylish and tastefully decorated, offer air conditioning, work desk, mini bar, tea and coffee making facilities and LCD TV. Catalina Restaurant and Bar serves contemporary Australian cuisine and features a stylish bar with separate lounge area. For your relaxation the hotel offers a massage service, gymnasium overlooking the action of the airport, sauna and magnificent roof top relaxation terrace with glass sided lap pool. Explore the nearby attractions like the excitement of Eagle Farm and Doomben Race Courses, the city’s grandest extravaganzas at the Brisbane Entertainment Centre and the exclusive dining and shopping precinct at Portside Wharf and Cruise Terminal.
